content: I do not have personal experience. however, kuala lumpur has made some improvements in recent years to make its transportation system more accessible for people with disabilities. the city has implemented barrier-free access on public transport services like buses, trains, and monorails. the lrt (light rail transit) system has wheelchair-friendly train cars, and almost all rapidkl buses are equipped with ramps or low floors for easier boarding. additionally, most of the newly opened lrt stations have wheelchair lifts to provide barrier-free access. however, there is still room for improvement, especially in terms of accessibility in older buildings and public spaces. overall, kuala lumpur's transportation system is becoming more accessible for people with disabilities, but it may still lag behind some other cities that have had longer to implement accessibility measures.
